title: Full steam ahead for China's Belt and Road Initiative in Indonesia
summary: Under the impetus of its president, Joko Widodo, Indonesia has embraced the Belt and Road Initiative project, attracting a record amount of Chinese investment. Meanwhile, Beijing is counting on the vast archipelago to expand its influence in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: In France, 1,040 anti-Semitic acts perpetrated since October 7
summary: France's Jewish population, estimated at over 500,000, is the largest in Europe and the third-biggest in the world, after Israel and the United States.

title: As war rages in Gaza, North Africa's streets are united, if not its governments
summary: Despite rivalries and political divisions between the region's countries, North Africa is reuniting around widespread movements in solidarity with the Palestinians.

title: Storm Domingos: French regions worried after third storm in a week
summary: The new storm that swept through France on November 4 and 5 has not caused any major damage, according to initial reports, but has complicated recovery efforts in areas already hit by Storm Ciaran.

title: Madagascar: France's silence over islands' presidential election causes confusion
summary: In a letter to the French parliament, the Malagasy opposition calls on Paris to acknowledge the gravity of the island crisis' – and put pressure on 'Frenchie' president, Andry Rajoelina.

title: Ethiopia's Tola, Kenya's Obiri the winners at New York City Marathon
summary: Tamirat Tola won the men's race in a time of 2:4:58, a course record. Reigning Boston Marathon champion Hellen Obiri won the women's race in 2:27:23.

title: 'To finance the energy transition, companies will have to reduce their shareholder remuneration'
summary: France's environmental goals can only be financed by transferring income from the wealthiest individuals to the government, to domestic savings, and to companies who invest in the environmental transition.

title: Israel minister reprimanded over Gaza nuclear 'option' comment
summary: Heritage Minister Amichai Eliyahu, an ultranationalist member of Netanyahu's coalition, was suspended from government meetings. The prime minister's office said Eliyahu was 'disconnected from reality.'

title: France urges 'immediate humanitarian truce' in Gaza war
summary: Foreign Minister Catherine Colonna called for 'an immediate, durable and observed humanitarian truce', adding that she was supporting a UN resolution to that effect.

title: Djokovic beats Dimitrov for seventh Paris Masters title
summary: Novak Djokovic won 6-4, 6-3 to clinch his 40th Masters 1000 title, and stretching his winning run to 18 matches.

title: Hamburg airport 'hostage situation' has ended
summary: An armed father who had taken his four-year-old daughter hostage gave himself up without resistance after hours of negotiations with police. The child appears unharmed.

title: Iron, fire and blood rain down on encircled Gaza City
summary: The Israeli army has completely encircled Gaza City, its main battleground against Hamas forces, and has exposed more than half a million people to combat and shortages of food and water.

title: More and more Israelis are signing up to own a gun
summary: Since Hamas's attack on October 7, 180,000 applications for permits to carry weapons have been submitted in Israel. The authorities are trying to keep pace with the growing demand for security.

title: Macron walks a tightrope over the war in Gaza
summary: The French president has been confronted with domestic tensions over the war between Israel and Hamas. He plans to hold a 'humanitarian conference' on November 9.

title: The slaughter of wild horses in Australia has become a battle 'for the soul' of the country
summary: Imported by early settlers, 'brumbies' are national symbols for some; for others, they're just another invasive species that needs to be strictly controlled to protect native species.

title: Paris FC's gamble: Free tickets for all until the end of the season
summary: The club, whose men's team competes in Ligue 2 and women's team in Division 1, has announced that 15,000 of the 17,000 seats at Stade Charléty will be available free of charge for all league matches until the end of the season.

title: Elysée Palace brings back public changing of guard
summary: The home of the French presidency said the ceremony, which was abandoned 27 years ago, would take place once a month starting on Tuesday.

title: Come for the culture, maybe don't stay for the food: Are museum restaurants worth a visit?
summary: With high prices and homogenized flavors in menus designed to please everyone, many restaurants run by renowned chefs fail to offer gastronomic delights that match the establishment's reputation. However, there are noteworthy exceptions.

title: Planting a billion trees in 10 years: Macron's risky promise for French forests
summary: The French president's commitment is worrying specialists, who believe that it focuses solely on numbers, at the expense of protecting biodiversity.

title: Earthquake-prone Nepal hit by another temblor
summary: Friday's 5.6 magnitude earthquake in western Nepal killed at least 157 people. The country's National Seismic Monitoring and Research Centre has recorded more than 70 quakes with a magnitude greater than 4 since the beginning of the year.

title: Chile's newest Constitution draft enters its home stretch
summary: On Tuesday, November 7, 2023, left-wing president Gabriel Boric will receive a proposal for a new text that has been prepared over eight months by experts and elected advisors. Polls indicate its possible rejection in a referendum on December 17.

title: 2024 European elections: A possible 'rural' campaign could shift lines of French right and far right
summary: A lobbyist advising the National Hunter's Federation is working on a list to defend 'rural values' in the European elections – with tacit support from President Emmanuel Macron.

title: French justice minister's trial for conflicts of interest opens
summary: Eric Dupond-Moretti is accused of having used his position to launch investigations into magistrates with whom he had run-ins as a lawyer. He will be judged by a special jurisdiction for members of government.

title: Visiting Kyiv, EU's von der Leyen gives Ukraine a much-needed boost
summary: While the war between Israel and Hamas is monopolizing the world's attention, the European Commission president said on Saturday that the country had made 'excellent progress' in the reforms deemed necessary before opening possible negotiations for EU membership.

title: Scientific journal impacted by Israel-Hamas war
summary: The editor-in-chief of 'eLife' magazine, Michael Eisen, was fired after a controversial tweet about the Israel-Hamas war, provoking a debate about freedom of speech.

title: Israeli army intensifies strikes on Gaza, plunging civilians into horror and hunger
summary: The enclave has been cut in two by the Israeli military, as the population of the north has been forced to flee to the south. Eighteen UN agencies are calling for an immediate humanitarian ceasefire.
